data.title: OS X New (Tab) Window doesn't focus
data.body:
When a new window (tab) is created in Atom on OS X the new tab doesn't get focus.
The "old" window has to be selected before it's possible to select the new window.

The following Packages are installed:

```
.atom/packages (11)
├── Sublime-Style-Column-Selection@1.1.2
├── a10-networks-aflex@0.2.0
├── a10-networks-snippets@0.1.0
├── a10-networks-syntax@0.3.0
├── file-icons@1.3.2
├── gist-it@0.5.0
├── git-plus@3.10.1
├── sort-lines@0.7.0
├── tasks@1.0.1
├── todo-show@0.5.1
└── trailing-spaces@0.2.3
```

The first screenshot is from the initial window when Atom is opened.

![screen shot 2014-08-16 at 21 43 58](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7456624/3942916/ebf247e2-257d-11e4-8ce1-cd0c8d227344.png)

The second screenshot is when apple-n is hit to open a new window. In the last screenshot the cursor is absent.

![screen shot 2014-08-16 at 21 44 10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7456624/3942917/ec0f2f92-257d-11e4-8ebd-c3c21c5d76d4.png)

data.title: OSX initial launch window position
data.body:
When launching Atom 0.123.0 for the first time the window is positioned at the top left corner so that the draggable part of the window in beneath the menu bar. This causes trouble moving the window.

![desktop](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1151567/3942659/633f5154-2570-11e4-841a-4be4d6fb8a18.png)

data.title: Slow undo on Atom
data.body:
So one thing I noticed in Atom is that the undo behavior is a bit slower than Sublime. The reason it looks like is because Sublime will buffer your keystrokes into groups, and when you undo, it undos the last **group** of keystrokes, instead of the last keystroke. Let me demonstrate:

Atom:
![](http://i.imgur.com/RoeOSe7.gif)

Sublime:
![](http://i.imgur.com/XZbwLMi.gif)

data.title: (Windows) Version number on "Help" menu not updating properly
data.body:
I've just updated Atom via Chocolatey to 0.123. Version still shows 0.116.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5153378/3941971/14a2f4a6-254d-11e4-91b4-46d95961fd94.png)

data.title: Http server is for experts
data.body:
http://atom.io says:

```
Node.js support makes it trivial to .... even start servers directly from within your editor
```

...but how to start servers? Docs says nothing about it. Menus says nothing about. Command palette says nothing about it. Google says nothing about it.

data.title: keybindings with multiple combined keys doesn't work since v0.121.0
data.body:
I have this on Ubuntu 14.04.

When I use the following default keybindings `'.workspace .editor':  'ctrl-k ctrl-u': 'editor:upper-case'` and `'.workspace .editor':  'ctrl-k ctrl-l': 'editor:lower-case'`, the second ctrl gets registered as a first key press. I have this with all bindings that have multiple ctrl's.

This is a recording of Keybinding resolver with `atom --safe` taken from ebbea64b3de1c41336b386d76a7f0dad70a7af88.

![ebbea64b3de1c41336b386d76a7f0dad70a7af88](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4266355/3941644/b6f8320c-2539-11e4-91bc-4b603507f0b8.gif)

This is a recording of Keybinding resolver with `atom --safe` taken from b3c241757801cf7a90d9e119f42e7a8ac498db10. (v0.120.0)

![b3c241757801cf7a90d9e119f42e7a8ac498db10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4266355/3941646/cd092880-2539-11e4-95e1-54f7e82a12d3.gif)
Here the keybindings work correct.

data.title: Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded when opening Settings
data.body:
The second I open Settings after the 0.123 update, the Chrome dev tools pop up and the number of `Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded` errors starts going up about 1200 per minute until I close Settings.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3588778/3940499/71d9ec66-24e3-11e4-9031-4f0d256ed496.png)

I'm on Windows 8.1.

data.title: Uncaught Error: EBUSY, resource busy or locked 'c:\hiberfil.sys'
data.body:
When typing `//` anywhere in a go document, I get this: `Uncaught Error: EBUSY, resource busy or locked 'c:\hiberfil.sys'`

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3588778/3940489/e9b83414-24e2-11e4-9205-877e9a0ba2f1.png)

I'm running Windows 8.1.

data.title: error msg: EditorScrollView scrolled when it shouldn't have
data.body:
Sometimes when I tell the editorView to scroll the log shows `EditorScrollView scrolled when it shouldn't have`. This has happened on older versions and 0.123.0.

It doesn't do any harm but it is a bug since I'm using a legitimate method of EditorView. The log is being cluttered up and I can't use the error indicator because it always has errors. 

This is my only code related to scrolling. I don't see anything wrong. I'd try to isolate the problem but that would be quite hard.

```
setViewPos = (pos, view) ->
  if pos and view
    [topLine, cursPos] = pos
    view.scrollToBufferPosition [topLine+2, 0]
    view.getEditor().setCursorBufferPosition cursPos
# called by
      setViewPos pos, atom.workspaceView.getActiveView()
```

and

```
@buffer.setText @curText
@editorView.scrollToBufferPosition [lineNum+2, 0]
lineOfs = @buffer.characterIndexForPosition [lineNum, 0]
cursPos = @buffer.positionForCharacterIndex lineOfs + charOfs
@editor.setCursorBufferPosition cursPos
atom.workspaceView.focus()
@statusView?.setMsg @getState()
```

windows 8.0 with atom 120

data.title: Settings page breaks when dragged to empty pane
data.body:
![screencap of bug reproduction](http://i.imgur.com/ZfVCqdo.gif)

Atom version: 0.123.0
Platform: OSX v10.9.4
### Reproduce:
1. Open new atom window with single pane, "pane1"
2. Open new pane, "pane2" (`cmd`+`k`+`arrow`)
3. Ensure pane2 is empty
4. Focus on pane1 & open Settings (`cmd`+`,`)
5. Drag Settings tab to empty pane2

As per screencap above, this bug only presents when the target pane is empty. Dragging to a pane which has an editor window open renders the Settings page normally.

data.title: Tighten lint rules
data.body:
coffeelint.json had some rules set to ignore, but since #3116 was merged there
are no violations of these rules in the code anymore. Tighten up the rules to
prevent those kinds of errors from creeping back in.

Test Plan:

Lint executes without finding any errors

```
$ ./script/grunt coffeelint
Running "coffeelint:src" (coffeelint) task
>> 80 files lint free.

Running "coffeelint:build" (coffeelint) task
>> 23 files lint free.

Running "coffeelint:test" (coffeelint) task
>> 40 files lint free.
Done, without errors.
```

data.title: "show invisibles" does not show invisibles
data.body:
v0.122.0

Turn on "show invisibles". Then quit atom.

Then in terminal, under your working directory, type "atom" (open in dev mode).

It does not show invisibles.

data.title: package.json: add less and walkdir deps
data.body: They weren't already in there and the build was failing because of it.  Adding them fixed it.

data.title: menubar showing gibberish.
data.body:
The menubar is showing gibberish. this may be a missing font. image below. thanks.
u.teknik.io/DMOvLc.png

data.title: :penguin: Set file mode to 755 to directories created for mkdeb.
data.body: `dpkg` will fail or create packages that are not runnable if the default permissions for new files are somewhat restrictive (e.g. `umask` is `0027`).

data.title: Apple’s Text to Speech stopped working in a recent update
data.body:
https://discuss.atom.io/t/apples-text-to-speech-stopped-working-in-a-recent-update/11518

I am visually impaired and I use OS X's feature "Speak selected text when the key is pressed" located in the Dictation & Speech preference pane. I just noticed that this feature no longer works in Atom as of one of the last two versions. It now only reads the window's title bar no matter what text I have selected. It was working just fine before. It also works just fine under Chrome itself.

I'm not sure what caused this to break, but I depend on this feature all the time and can't really do without it. Does anyone have any ideas as to why?

I'm currently on v0.122 and I know it was working on v0.120 or v0.119. I'm also pretty sure I had enabled the React Editor before I noticed this being a problem, so I don't think that caused it.

data.title: Folders and files are getting locked in Windows 7
data.body:
May effect other versions of windows, but here's the scenario:
- Running a build task that deletes a 'build' sub folder under my project folder and recreates it
- When the root of my project is opened in Atom, it seems to lock the 'build' folder once it is initially created
- running my build task again throws error because the build folder is locked (or some file within it)

Atom should not have a hard lock on the filesystem to prevent this...

data.title: Upgrade to atom-shell@0.15.7
data.body: Fixes the crash under Linux.

data.title: Added info about installation on some Linuxes
data.body: Atom has been packaged for several distributions, hence I'm adding info about this.

data.title: Horizontal scrollbar click moves cursor
data.body:
When clicking and dragging the horizontal scrollbar the cursor is moved to the line visible immediately above the scrollbar. This is particularlhy problematic when placing a cursor at the start of a selection then scrolling to shift-click the end of the selection.

Issue appears in v0.122.0 on Windows 7 and v0.121.0 on Windows 8.1

data.title: Some missing key bindings in menu
data.body:
In v122 (Win7), I accidentally noticed that some menu items are still missing the full key binding and only have the first part, specifically these three:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7287076/3932934/9c09a78e-2474-11e4-8e53-400adcbaeef5.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7287076/3932939/b094528a-2474-11e4-8cd7-d5d5c4202c5c.png)

All the others appear to be fine.

This is related to issue #2971.

data.title: 0.122.0: Invisible characters hidden on launch
data.body:
Atom 0.122.0
OS X 10.9.4

The 0.122.0 update seems to have an issue with invisible characters being hidden on launch even though they are enabled. Disabling and re-enabling fixes the issue until the next time Atom is launched.

I ran Atom in safe mode then with a clean `~/.atom` directory, the issue persisted.

data.title: Tree view and tab bar eat click events
data.body:
Was trying to capture click events on the workspace using:

``` coffee
atom.workspaceView.on 'click', (e) -> ...
```

Clicks on the editor work, but the tree view and tab bar do not. Looking at the source, they're calling `e.stopPropagation()` on the event. Is this necessary?

data.title: I don't want to close the window, when atom is started.
data.body:
i like using the atom with a treeview(sidebar),however ,when i open a folder its always start a new window even if the window have no the file being edited 
[note: win7 x86-64]

data.title: Cursor is missing when window focus is changed
data.body:
I'm using Atom version: **0.121.0** for **Linux(Manjaro)**, this problem wasn't happening on the previous version.

I tried to run `atom --safe` but the problem persist.

The cursor is gone but I still have the line highlighted.

These are the steps I follow to reproduce the error:
- Change windows with `ALT+TAB` and set the focus to this other window, also using `ALT+TAB` go back to Atom, the cursor is gone.
- If I make this process but instead of `ALT+TAB` I click on the window button on my panel, it works because on each click I'm also setting the focus to the window.

data.title: Restore maximized state of window
data.body:
Restore the maximized state of the window on Windows and Linux, Mac OS X does not have a "maximized" state, just size and position that extends corner to corner.

Closes #2936
Closes #2951
